summary: The "secretarial allowance" is a financial provision allocated to Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) to support their administrative and operational needs. This allowance is designed to facilitate the effective execution of parliamentary duties by enabling MEPs to employ staff for secretarial and administrative functions. The regulation governing the secretarial allowance ensures transparency and accountability in its use, aligning with the broader principles of good governance within EU institutions. By providing this allowance, the European Parliament aims to enhance the efficiency of its members, thereby promoting democratic engagement and legislative effectiveness across the Union.
